title: NPP tops Elpitiya PS Election
byline: The results of the Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Election was released last night, with the National People’s Power (NPP) coming out on top.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara and Mannar districts.

title: Train services on Northern Line to resume tomorrow
byline: The train services from Colombo Fort to Kankasanturai which was halted for months owing to the maintenance and development activities will resume starting tomorrow, October 28, the Department of Railways has announced.

title: 2024 General Election: Distribution of official polling cards begins
byline: The Postal Department announced that the distribution of official polling cards for the upcoming parliamentary elections will begin today (Oct 27).

title: Police open fire at lorry in Sooriyawewa
byline: Police have opened fire at a lorry that refused to comply with orders to stop for inspection, in the Meegahajadura area of Sooriyawewa today (27).

title: Passenger arrested with over 5 kg of ‘Ice’ at BIA
byline: A passenger arriving from Malaysia has been arrested while in the possession of over 05 kilograms of ‘Ice’ drugs (crystal methamphetamine), at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: Two Russians arrested for staying without valid visas
byline: Kandy Tourist Police Unit has arrested a Russian couple who were residing in the country without valid visas in violation of immigration and emigration regulations.

title: 12 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: Sri Lanka Navy has seized an Indian fishing boat and apprehend 12 Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters, during a special operation conducted off Point Pedro, Jaffna today (27).

title: Bus in Mexico crashes after colliding with trailer that detached from truck killing 24
byline: A bus tipped over in central Mexico after colliding with a trailer that detached from a truck transporting corn, killing 24 people and injuring five, Mexican authorities said Saturday.

title: Tensions erupt following Ranjan Ramanayake’s political conference over compensation
byline: A tense situation unfolded outside the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium following the conclusion of a conference of the United Democratic Voice, the new alliance led by prominent figure Ranjan Ramanayake.

title: Measures in place to control PRRS spread in Sri Lanka - Authorities
byline: The recently spreading swine disease ‘Porcine Reproductive & Respiratory Syndrome’ (PRRS) has been identified as an African Swine Disease, says the Department of Animal Production and Health.
